How Treaty of Versailles ended World War 1 but set the stage for World War 2The Treaty of Versailles, which was signed on June 28, 1919, was intended to bring peace following World War I — but instead produced a greater war, World War 2. After Germany was forced to assume sole responsibility for the war, pay enormous reparations, and give up valuable territory such as Alsace-Lorraine, it sowed the seeds for the next War.
